The game FoldIt is fairly fascinating (or at least it's reasons for existing are). It's a spinoff of the Rosetta@Home distributed protein folding research projects (on the BOINC platform, the same as is currently used for Seti data processing), used largely for medical research. The game exists because people can come up with protein folding solutions that computers can't.

So not only is it based on real science, the output is used for actual real science
